caption: The Orangerie is too easily overlooked by visitors to Paris who are keen to 'do' the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, and other major attractions, which is a great shame, because this unassuming building houses some of the art world's great masterpieces. Even if you only go to see the eight monumental waterlily paintings by Monet, the visit will be more than worth it. However, before viewing the Monet paintings, I recommended heading downstairs to see the fantastic collection or works that include Picasso, Manet, Matisse and other great luminaries of art.

It's a really good museum to see the paintings of Claude Monet. This museum has the great Water lilies painting. It has a permanent exhibition of many great painters like PABLO PICASSO. If you're in Paris you must visit this museum.

We had a wonderful visit here last week. It started on a rough note as there was a strike with workers in the museums.  My timed entry and tickets were not honored. But we were soon inside and here I‚Äôll mention that I went to reception and requested a refund on my tickets and I received that today. The display of Monet‚Äôs Water Lilies is simply extraordinary.  The art will take your breath away and the large oval-shaped display rooms are perfect for this art. I enjoyed the visit immensely.

An incredible museum that houses many outstand works by Picasso and other masterpieces. The main attraction is two large oval shaped room that present Claude Monet's Water Lilies as he wanted them presented. The flow and layout of the displays are outstanding. Easy to follow maps and directions because the building is just about perfect in size and the audio guides were very informative.

What a unique museum that allows you to see Monet‚Äôs classic works the way he intended it. The murals of water lilies are like windows looking out onto Monet‚Äôs pond, you feel transformed from a museum to a veranda. If you are a lover of the water lilies, this is a must see experience.

The centrepieces, Monet‚Äôs Nymph√©as, are breathtaking, circling around a large oval room allowing you to fully immerse yourself in his universe.  The permanent exhibitions are also quite memorable with really interesting artwork from artists I had not heard of - but have come to appreciate.  My only gripe is that it is relatively small and gets crowded even in the morning.

Beautiful museum this was on my ‚Äúmust see‚Äù list when visiting Paris and was definitely a highlight.  I went on a Friday around 11am and there was no wait time for me! I didn‚Äôt even book tickets in advanced as I thought Europeans under 25s go free, however as the UK is no longer in the EU this is not the case for British people (so bear this in mind) but I was able to buy a ticket at the desk.  They also have a great gift shop at the museum, If you love Monet‚Äôs work I 100% recommend!

My favorites museum in Paris, the most beautiful architecture with sunlight. I personally think monet‚Äôs painting looks more beautiful when it was in Mus√©e de l‚Äôorangerie. The place gave me strong impression and inspired a lot. Worthy to visit!

Better if you have a reservation before coming. Though took short time to get one and enter in after security check; the place is outstanding, the nymph√©as of Monnet are a total must to look at and meditate.  Cezanne, Picasso, Derain, Laurencin, Modigliani, Klee, Matisse‚Ä¶. A concentration of grandnesses . A must, absolutely

Any time it is possible to see the Monet's masterpieces. Two halls on the ground floor are dedicated to his Water lilies and to the Nymphes. Now, the most existing exhibition is represented: the collection of Berggruen Museum of Berlin with the chef-d'≈ìuvres of Picasso, Matisse,  Klee

Highly recommend buying tickets in advance to skip the line and not wait outside when it gets cold!  However in case of me and my friends it was VERY challenging to buy tickets ( and I almost never have issues with buying tickets anywhere else)!  Their website continuously was interrupting the session showing the errors like ‚Äúexpired session‚Äù or ‚Äúinvalid card‚Äù while everything was ok with the card. Lastly we managed to buy tickets after about 10 trials ü´†  For the museum itself - it was bigger than we expected and quite a lot of things to see! Art pieces were beautiful!‚òÄÔ∏è

This is a lovely little art gallery. It‚Äôs not huge, but there is some beautiful artwork here. The queue to get in was very long though whether you had tickets or not. So that was a bit annoying. Plus some of the staff were a bit rude. But overall it was an enjoyable experience.

Even if you think you've seen enough of Monet's endless waterlilies, don't be discouraged to go. Not only is this an exceptional setting in which you've never seen them, but l'Orangerie has many more beautiful tableaux to take in and admire. Book your tickets well in advance!!
L'Orangerie offered an excellent museum experience. Monet‚Äôs water lily panels  are worth the price of admission. Very elegant and understated collection. Well worth a visit!

We visited the Mus√©e de l'Orangerie during a night opening on November 1st and feel like we couldn't have been luckier with that. Monet's vision for those of us wanting to see his Nymph√©as was one of tranquility and for there to be room to feel at peace. I would think this feeling is hard to come by during the usually busy and popular opening hours. While the museum tries people to stay more or less quiet in those two halls, a lot of people don't seem to get it. I have been looking for feelings of peace and tranquility for a very long time now, struggling with intense anxiety, I felt so well while sitting there. For the first time in a very long time I could just 'be', I could simply exist and enjoy just doing that. This night opening meant the world to me! Thank you!
Museum featuring a number of galleries most notably of Monet‚Äôs and Picasso‚Äôs work. Definitely worth a visit.

One beautiful museum and an absolute must see in Paris. Although it‚Äôs smaller than other well known museums in Paris, there is a lot to see and a lot to admire in the museum. They have a very wide and beautiful collection of paintings from many different iconic painters like Monet, Laurencin, Matisse or Derain.  I had an incredible time visiting this museum, I found myself admiring all the paintings and work of arts there. The museum is not too crowded as well, so you can take all the time you need to admire the work of arts.  I most definitely recommend visiting this museum when you come and visit Paris.
An amazing homage to impressionism.  A fabulous space and home for Claude Monets impressively large works of art.  Amongst many others.

The Mus√©e de l'Orangerie in Paris is a must-visit for art enthusiasts. It is located in the Tuileries Gardens and houses an impressive collection of Impressionist and Post-Impressionist masterpieces. The museum's highlight is the Water Lilies murals by Claude Monet, displayed in specially designed oval-shaped rooms. The museum showcases a stunning collection of artwork by celebrated artists including Renoir, C√©zanne, and Picasso. However, the museum's popularity has led to overcrowding and challenges in maintaining the peaceful atmosphere it aims to provide. One downside being that it is challenging to find a quiet spot to mindfully observe the Water Lilies, which is (was) the main purpose of the (our) visit. Nevertheless, a visit to the Mus√©e de l'Orangerie is an enriching and unforgettable experience for anyone with a love for art and culture.

Beautiful gallery that I‚Äôve been dreaming of visiting for a long time. Apart from a very big amount of tourists it was wonderful. I recommend getting tickets in advance and come either right at the opening or closing time.

Impressive "gigantic" works of Monet are displayed in a building adopped just for those works! While it was amazing to see this extraordinary body of work by Monet, it was somewhat difficult to contemplate upon and enjoy the paintings because of the following factors. One is that the paintings are so big that the whole picture could not be grasped without the reflections from the illuminating light and (2) very high number of the visitors created some chaotic environment and atmosphere, contrasting with the calm and peaceful themes and intent of the paintings. Improvements in these regards would, I think, make visitors (and perhaps Monet himself) happier as the intent of displaying is for people to appreciate the artist and the paintings. Hopefully, such improvements can be made while balancing the financial considerations from Museum's perspectives.

As for me, impressionism lover, it‚Äôs a no 1 place to visit in Paris. Amazing display of the greatest works of arts in the world. The gallery is quite small but I like to let myself spend some time inside and soak in the art. For the tickets - it‚Äôs best to book in advance as there‚Äôs no need to wait in line.
Worth visiting. I would recommend ordering tickets in advance. I was able to visit it for free because I my age is between 18- 25, which was lovely.
I enjoyed the museum and thought the paintings were beautiful. However, I found the room with Van Gogh‚Äôs panoramic works a bit too dark. Still, it‚Äôs definitely worth a visit!
A must do for Monet lovers. There are also some others beautiful collections. Can be really busy during the summer which can make it hard to fully enjoy the paintings.

Lots of huge Monet Waterlilies and also a bit of Picasso, not a huge gallery but we enjoyed it, we visited the Mus√®e de L'Orsay the day before and could have easily fitted this in after a short break rather than travelling back across Paris to visit the following day.

Be sure to book in advance. Pros: the art, especially Monet's Water Lilies, is breathtaking. Cons: the crowd. The sheer number of visitors and the lack of quiet can detract from the experience. Monet intended Water Lilies to be enjoyed in peaceful silence, but the loud chatter and packed rooms make it challenging to fully appreciate. This can make the visit feel less enjoyable and a bit stressful. I had to wait for them to almost close to sit down and have a silent moment to really enjoy the art. Maybe is best to book the first entry of the day.
Small museum, but worth a visit for Claude Monet‚Äôs water lillies.  They also have a room for kids to play and do activities in, a cafe and restroom facilities.
It was nice being surrounded by amazing artworks done by masters of art world. Overall small, it would take you to view the whole exhibition maximum in 2 hours.

Lovely museum with a must-see on the ground floor with Monnet‚Äôs paintings. It's worth going even if you don't have enough time to see these‚Ä¶ 40-60 minutes seem enough. Highly impressive and relaxing experience.
Worth a visit just to see the Monet‚Äôs. Downstairs exhibitions were also great. Good size gallery, enough to satiate but not too much to overwhelm.
Very nice museum. Would recommend for anyone who enjoys museums.
A very good museum with famous Monet water lilies and many other amazing paintings
If you are going to see Monet‚Äôs Water Lillies don‚Äôt expect tranquility. Too many people. Too much noise. Quite a disappointment  The Ryman display may appeal to some ‚Ä¶ certainly not me !!!

Such a must! We visited as a family (we have a 4&7 year old). They loved it, such beautiful art.  Didn‚Äôt buy tickets in advance - but I would have if I had been more organised. The queue changes depending on the time and day. But for ease and stress free book in advance but don‚Äôt be put off just dropping by
Amazing place, not huge, but everything there is of the highest quality and it's nicely laid out, not overwhelming like some other nearby places.

Only came for the Water Lilies‚Äîyep, that was the only highlight for me‚Ä¶ the rest of the exhibition was too abstract for my liking. There was a gallery of just blank canvasses‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs ‚Äúart‚Äù for you, I guess!  I should also mention, the staff outside will only let people in once every 10 or so minutes. DO NOT come in the afternoon when the sun will cook you alive, as they force you to queue in the heat! Of course, they have umbrellas for shade‚Ä¶ but only for the staff..
It was easy to book on lune and there wasn't any queue early in the day (before midday). The paintings are amazing and it's worth taking the time to sit or stand and take it all in.
